awd_titl_txt: Synthesis and Applications of Enantiomerically Pure         Helicates
awd_abstract_narration: This starter grant award of the Chemistry Division to Cornell University   supports the research of Professor Geoffrey W. Coates.  The themes of the   research are synthesis and application of enantiomerically pure   helicates.  Work is directed to the synthesis of two classes of optically   active ligands that are specifically designed to form enantiomerically   pure helicates in the presence of metal ions that prefer tetrahedral   coordination geometries.  Investigations include the mechanism of helix   wrapping and unwinding and the application of helicates as catalysts for   asymetric synthesis.  The project, with components of organic synthesis,   inorganic stereochemistry, and catalysis, facilitates the comprehensive   training of graduate students.  The research leads to the synthesis of a new class of optically active   compounds whose helical structures resemble those of proteins and nucleic   acids.  Applications provide new opportunities in the fields of   enantioselective catalysis, biochemistry, and molecular topology.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
